404.title: Page not found
404.paragraph1: If you typed the web address, check it is correct.
404.paragraph2: If you pasted the web address, check you copied the entire address.

GLW.description: Creu Atodiad VII a hysbysu swyddogion asiantaethau amgylcheddol os ydych yn bwriadu allforio gwastraff rhestr werdd.

signinPage.title: You need to sign in to access this page
signinPage.button: Sign in or create an account

startPage.title: Export green list waste: submit Annex VII records on the waste tracking service
startPage.summary: Summary: Green list waste exporters can use the export waste from the UK service to record all their Annex VII exports.

serviceFeatures.description: Exporters can use this service to:
serviceFeatures.listElementOne: enter the details of a single green list waste export
serviceFeatures.listElementTwo: upload information about multiple exports of green list waste using templates, or as a CSV spreadsheet using the
serviceFeatures.listElementTwoLink: Green list waste multiple exports: CSV file template
serviceFeatures.listElementThree: update any estimates you may have entered – for example, collection date or first carrier
serviceFeatures.listElementFour: download and print Annex VIIs to include with your waste shipment (this will be created using the information that you enter)

startPage.paragraph: You will still need to notify your regulators of any movements you intend to make.

beforeYouStart.title: Before you start
beforeYouStart.descriptionOne: Before you can use the waste tracking service, you must:
beforeYouStart.listElementOne: Sign in or create a Government Gateway account for your business or organisation if you do not have one yet. Do not use a Government Gateway account created to access your personal information.
beforeYouStart.listElementTwo: Sign in or register for a business or organisation Defra account using this Government Gateway ID if you do not have one yet.
beforeYouStart.descriptionTwo: Because you're registering on behalf of a business or organisation, you'll also need:
beforeYouStart.unorderedListElementOne: the main contact details for your business or organisation (for example, head office contact details)
beforeYouStart.unorderedListElementTwo: the Companies House number if the business or organisation is a limited company
beforeYouStart.insetText: The first account that you create for your business or organisation will automatically be an ‘admin account’. This account can be used to create andapprove additional admin or standard accounts within the same business or organisation.
beforeYouStart.descriptionThree: You can set up these accounts when you select ‘Start now’.
beforeYouStart.descriptionFour: If you’re an agent acting on behalf of an exporter, you must register for the waste tracking service using your own business details.

exportImportControls.title: Check export controls
exportImportControls.descriptionOne: If you plan to export waste from the UK, you must report this in advance, before the waste is picked up by the first carrier. You’ll be able to update estimates to actuals later.
exportImportControls.descriptionTwo: Check the regulatory controls that apply when you:
exportImportControls.linkOne: export waste from or import waste to England
exportImportControls.linkTwo: export waste from or import waste to Scotland
exportImportControls.linkThree: export waste from or import waste to Wales
exportImportControls.linkFour: export waste from or import waste to Northern Ireland

getHelpTechnicalIssue.title: Get help with a technical issue
getHelpTechnicalIssue.descriptionOne: You can contact the move and track waste service support team if you need help with a technical issue, such as problems accessing the service.
getHelpTechnicalIssue.descriptionTwo: The waste recording service support team will not be able to answer regulatory questions.

getHelpRegulatoryIssue.title: Get help with a regulatory issue
getHelpRegulatoryIssue.descriptionOne: If you need help from a regulator to complete waste movement or export notifications, you can contact your relevant national regulatory team. They will not be able to answer technical questions about service problems.
getHelpRegulatoryIssue.descriptionTwo: For additional regulatory guidance, you can also visit:
getHelpRegulatoryIssue.linkOne: EA (Environment Agency) business waste and environmental impact
getHelpRegulatoryIssue.linkTwo: SEPA (Scottish Environment protection Agency) waste information
getHelpRegulatoryIssue.linkThree: DEARA ( Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs) waste policy tracker
